result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gordon L Bittner Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Atty Jeremy Chavez requesting modification of the JOC - forwarded to Judge Paulson

Defendant Gordon L Bittner in court with attorney Jeremy Chavez.  Chris D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
Plea - 15CT391 - G.
BTC: 15CT391 - GUILTY.      15CM1851 & 15TR14343 - DRI.
Def is requesting that the deft be put on ELM instead of serving time in jail for reasons stated on the record.
BTC: Matter adjourned for a short period of time to look into options regarding the deft's child.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Gordon L Bittner in court with attorney Jeremy Chavez.  Chris D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Leslie Johnson.
Matter was scheduled for Plea and sentencing today.
Defense is requesting an adjournment.
State does not object.
BTC: Matter adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gordon L Bittner in court with attorney Jeremy Chavez.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Deft is about half way through treatment.
Def is requesting a change of plea date in January.
BTC: Matter adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gordon L Bittner in court with attorney Jeremy Chavez.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond to remain as previously as set.  Status conference scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gordon L Bittner not in court.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee. 
Atty Henry requesting an adjournment in writting  Hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
From Atty Henry req adj of 8/20 hearing
Initial appearance on August 20, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  Do not drive unless properly licensed.  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Gordon L Bittner in court.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.
Defendant would like to obtain counsel. 
BTC: Matter is adjourned.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
